title: Identify the Variables
text: First, identify the initial and final energy levels. In this problem, the initial energy level $$n_i$$ is $$3$$, and the final energy level $$n_f$$ is $$1$$.

title: Understand Rydberg's Equation
text: Rydberg's equation is $$\frac{1}{\lambda}=\operatorname{R_H}\left(\frac{1}{{n_f}^2}-\frac{1}{{n_i}^2}\right)$$. Here, λ is the wavelength, $$R_H$$ is the Rydberg constant, $$n_f$$ is the final energy level, and $$n_i$$ is the initial energy level.

title: Substitute the Values
text: Substitute the known values into Rydberg's equation: $$\frac{1}{\lambda}=\operatorname{R_H}\left(\frac{1}{1^2}-\frac{1}{3^2}\right)$$.

title: Calculate the Difference
text: Calculate the difference inside the parentheses: $$\frac{1}{1^2}-\frac{1}{3^2}=1-\frac{1}{9}$$.

title: Calculate $$\frac{1}{\lambda}$$
text: Now, calculate $$\frac{1}{\lambda}=\frac{8R_H}{9}$$. Use the Rydberg constant $$R_H=1.097373{x10}^7$$ $$m^{-1}$$.

title: Find λ
text: Finally, find λ by taking the reciprocal of the result from the previous step.

title: Convert to Nanometers
text: Convert the wavelength from meters to nanometers by multiplying by $${10}^9$$.
